%s,
You have been given a warning by %s.
Reason: %s %s %s

Points are used to automatically give a member an appropriate punishment. The more severe the behaviour, the more points should be issued. The administrator has defined the following guidelines for issuing points:
%s is already permanently restricted from posting
You have been issued a warning by a moderator. Before you can post again, you must acknowledge the warning.
%s is already restricted from posting until %s

%s is already on moderation queue until %s
You must select a reason for giving this warning.

To view the full details for this warning, visit the warning log at the link below: %s
To view the full details for this warning, visit your warning log at the link below: %s
You have been given a warning
%s has been given a warning by %s

When warning a member, they will be given a punishment according to the number of points they will have after the warning. You may be able to set custom punishments in certain circumstances. The pre-defined punishments are:
You can use this to automatically remove the points given from this warning after a specified period of time. Leave blank to not remove points.
Select a reason to determine punishment.
This note will be shown to the member. You should explain here why you are warning the member.
This note will only be shown to other moderators and administrators. The member being warned will not be able to see it.
